title: Noticiario Espanol, from a Spanish newsreel from the 1940s
author: DwightFry

comments.content:
This looks like a sample from TV or a film, and possibly something older than the 60's. I'm guessing that it was hand-lettering or film type. The most similar digital font I found was [Waldstein](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202092426/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?&q=Waldstein&x=17&y=4&sample_text=NOTICIARIO%20ESPANOL) from Fountain. It does not have the top serif on the A, but few fonts do. I tried to match as many letters as I could, and I think the A is the only one that would need much modification.

- Mike Yanega
Thanks! The capture is from a Spanish newsreel from the 1940s, so it's easy to imagine it was either custom or a font that didn't find its way to the digital era.
